subject: Re: [junit] How to test XML file processing?
msgSnippet: ... To test it as it is, you ll need test data on the file system, and you ll want to try various error cases, such as file not found, file contains something
messageBody:
jxingtang wrote:

> I have a method to read an XML file and then use DOM to extract the
> data. Can anyone recommend a good way to unit test this method? The
> code snippet is blow:
>
> public void processConfigFile( String fileNameArg )
> throws IllegalArgumentException
> {
> File configFile = new File( fileNameArg );
> if( configFile.exists() == false )
> {
> String msg = "Failed to locate the specified
> configuration file \"" +
> fileNameArg + "\"";
> throw new IllegalArgumentException( msg );
> }
>
> DocumentBuilderFactory factory =
> DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance();
>
> try
> {
> DocumentBuilder builder =
> factory.newDocumentBuilder();
> configDoc = builder.parse( configFile );
> }
> ....

To test it as it is, you'll need test data on the file system, and
you'll want to try various error cases, such as file not found, file
contains something other than well-formed XML, file contains well-formed
XML with the wrong elements, ...

Just start with a different XML file for each test case, then write a
test for each.

One change I'll suggest: instead of returning nothing, change this
method so that it returns a data structure containing the data you parse
from your XML document. This makes it easier to make assertions about
the actual parsing.

Take care.
